info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 4:49PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHERN RIO ARRIBA AND NORTHEASTERN SANDOVAL COUNTIES THROUGH 515 PM MDT... At 449 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Fenton Lake State Park, or 17 miles southeast of Cuba, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Jemez Springs, Fenton Lake State Park and Jemez State Monument. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
